pullRequest.body:
This is the first PR in a series that will add proofs of the relevant properties of certain functions that are important for the proof of a density version of Dirichlet's Theorem on primes in AP (and, as a corollary, the Prime Number Theorem).

Here we add a short new file with "logarithmic" versions of the Euler product of a completely multiplicative function.

From [EulerProducts](https://github.com/MichaelStollBayreuth/EulerProducts).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

@Ruben-VandeVelde As this PR is blocking the next ones, I'd like to get it merged soon. Maybe we can separate the discussion on the `fun_prop` attribute and deal with it in a potential new PR? I think otherwise, it should be fine.
Made a [Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/fun_prop.20attribute.20for.20Complex.2Elog.20lemmas.3F/near/482347068) for the `fun_prop` question.
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: MichaelStollBayreuth can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Thanks @loefflerd !
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11835916486/job/32979709141)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11835916486/job/32979709490)
Thanks!

LGTM now

maintainer merge
Thanks!

LGTM now

maintainer merge
Any reason this shouldn't be on the declaration?
Probably not, except that `fun_prop` is not able to prove the side condition by itself (see the `fun_prop (disch := assumption)` in the proof below.
I assume that *if* I put the attribute directly on the declaration, I should add it to *all* the declarations in `Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Complex.LogDeriv`?
For now, I have made the attribute `local`, to avoid downstream effects.
It's too bad that you have to specify `f` explicitly here
Yes; it times out without specifying `f`.

I might be inclined to split this:
```suggestion
open Topology in
/-- If `f : α → ℂ` is summable, then so is `n ↦ log (1 - f n)`. -/
lemma Summable.clog_one_sub {α  : Type*} {f : α → ℂ} (hsum : Summable f) :
    Summable (fun n ↦ log (1 - f n)) := by
  have hg : DifferentiableAt ℂ (fun z ↦ log (1 - z)) 0 := by
    have : 1 - 0 ∈ slitPlane := (sub_zero (1 : ℂ)).symm ▸ one_mem_slitPlane
    fun_prop (disch := assumption)
  have : (fun z ↦ log (1 - z)) =O[𝓝 0] id := by
    simpa only [sub_zero, log_one] using hg.isBigO_sub
  exact this.comp_summable hsum

/-- If `f : α → ℂ` is summable, then so is `n ↦ -log (1 - f n)`. -/
lemma Summable.neg_clog_one_sub {α  : Type*} {f : α → ℂ} (hsum : Summable f) :
    Summable (fun n ↦ -log (1 - f n)) :=
  hsum.clog_one_sub.neg
```

Not sure if this is better
```suggestion
  have hp (p : Nat.Primes) : 1 - f p ≠ 0 :=
    sub_ne_zero_of_ne <| ne_of_apply_ne Norm.norm <| norm_one (α := ℂ) ▸ (hs p.prop.one_lt).ne'
```
I don't see an advantage.

Maybe
```suggestion
/-- A variant of the Euler Product formula in terms of the exponential of a sum of logarithms,
with the function unbundled. -/
```
line break missing. Can `Summable.neg_clog_one_sub` perhaps be inlined?
OK.
maybe add a comment explaining why this is only done locally?
Done.

```suggestion
    fun h ↦ norm_one (α := ℂ) ▸ (sub_eq_zero.mp h) ▸ hs p.prop.one_lt |> .false
```
I like it better without the space.
Well, I don't. What are your views on `fun h ↦ (norm_one (α := ℂ) ▸ (sub_eq_zero.mp h) ▸ hs p.prop.one_lt).false`?
Switched to using parens here (no desire to enter a fight over the space...)

I doubt that this lemma is going to get used repeatedly, so maybe it might be better to decide which of these is more useful for your application (Dirichlet characters?) and stick with it, rather than providing both bundled and unbundled forms.
OK. I use the bundled version later, so I'll remove the unbundled one.
is the `conv` really needed? won't a `simp` or `simp_rw` do it?
After replacing the last `p` by `_`, `simp only` actually works (and can be combined with the previous line).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(NumberTheory/EulerProduct/ExpLog): new file
